p: Ten mL of blood samples was collected twice from antecubital veins in the morning after an overnight fasting, on the second day of the women’s menstrual cycle; first, as the pre-intervention, and second, as the post intervention (three months later). The blood samples were centrifuged for 10 min at 4000 rpm to separate the serum. The extracted serum was divided into four aliquots and kept frozen at −70 °C until assay.
